person.persName: John W. Pulliam (Franklin co., farmer, pvt. 2nd Ky Inf (CSA) and 1st Ky Light Artillery (USA))

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Pulliam and Lucinda Pulliam. Married to Sarah Pulliam. Father of Mary Pulliam. Resident in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Franklin County in 1860. Farmer in Franklin County in 1863. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from July 13, 1861. Captured at Fort Donelson, Tennessee, on February 16, 1862. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on July 9, 1863. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a private from April 24, 1864. Reported as deserted from Lexington, Kentucky, on May 9, 1864. Returned to duty August 3, 1864. Reported as deserted from Mt. Sterling, Kentucky, on January 6, 1865. Mustered out July 26, 1865.
